page.title: 01The landscape near Holcot.
page.content: The area lies some seven miles to the north of the town of{Northampton. The land rises gently from the south but falls away in the north toward the great expanse of water at{Pitsford {Reservoir. The reservoir supplies water to the nearby town of Northampton.It is also a popular{leisure centre}for fishing, water sports and bird watching. Most of the undulating landscape is devoted to agriculture.About two thirds of the area is covered by fields and crops of various kinds. Low population and open countryside has resulted in the area being able to support a wide variety of wildlife. To the north-east lies Holcot, a village built of Northamptonshire stone, with a population of about 34O. Holcot was mentioned in the Domesday book of King William.
